ngiemboon: E Ssé gwaa cÿɔʼɔ Nowa pâ penkʉ́ pé, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pi zyé mboŋó, ngẅɛ̀ gi zyéen, ńgyɔ́ɔn ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ.
en: God blessed Noah and his sons and said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the earth.

ngiemboon: Menɔ̀ɔn ntsèm pâ meshʉ̌ŋ ntsèm pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ tà mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á kʉ́ʼʉ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, mbɔɔ messó, pɔ́ ge láʼa cʉ́ʼʉ tsẅé pɔ́gɔ gẅí pɔ́g; n cʉmé wɔ́b né pi.
en: The fear and terror of you will be in every living creature on the earth, every bird of the sky, every creature that crawls on the ground, and all the fish of the sea. They are placed under your authority.

ngiemboon: Akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie á gíŋte tà ńgẅiin zẅìge, ngwɔ́ pi lɔg ńgÿo shúm léjÿó sí; m bǔ ńná sɔɔn shúm ntsèm né pi, páʼ n da zɔɔn ńnáa legǐ sẅisẅê.
en: Every creature that lives and moves will be food for you;   as I gave the green plants, I have given you everything.  # 9:1–3 Gn 1:28–30

ngiemboon: Táʼ, tà pi ké ḿpfɛ́ mbab nɔ̀ɔn gẅie à kwě fómefomé, ńtí nue metse mé lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ we legwɔ́ wó.
en: However, you must not eat meat with its lifeblood in it.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ n ge gÿo ŋaga gẅí, páʼ pi ka gÿo lé metse mí, mie é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ gẅi legwɔ́ wó la, n ge gÿo gíŋe ńŋaga nɔ̀ɔn gẅie à zẅě nyìŋ mesoŋ, é ŋaga nyìŋ mesoŋ gẅie à zẅě wetsɔ̌.
en: And I will require a penalty for your lifeblood;   I will require it from any animal  # 9:5 Ex 21:28 and from any human; if someone murders a fellow human, I will require that person’s life.  # 9:5 Gn 4:2,8

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿpfɛte metse nyìŋ mesoŋ,
en: Whoever sheds human blood,

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na pi, pi zyé mboŋó, ngẅɛ̀ gi zyéen, ńgyɔ́ɔn ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ.»
en: But you, be fruitful and multiply; spread out over the earth and multiply on it.”

ngiemboon: E Ssé gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwó Nowa pâ gubé yé ngie:
en: Then God said to Noah and his sons with him,

ngiemboon: «Pege ge gwaa kʉ̀a, á gwɔ́ kʉ̀a gie á líe mbɔɔ ngẅɛ̀ gi gie e ge láʼ tá gwɔ́ wó,
en: “Understand that I am establishing my covenant   with you and your descendants after you,

ngiemboon: ńdíe mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á gẅiin zẅìge, ńgwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ pi: páʼ meshʉ̌ŋ, páʼ menɔ̀ɔn mbàʼ mbɔɔ mekúe menɔ̀ɔn pie é la pú fó tsɛ̀ɛ páŋ ńkẅɛ, tà mbɔɔ pie é ge láʼ tá gwɔ́ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ.
en: and with every living creature that is with you #— #birds, livestock, and all wildlife of the earth that are with you #— #all the animals of the earth that came out of the ark.

ngiemboon: Akʉ̀a ŋwɛ́, aa páʼ n těen ńdáʼa lyɛ̌ʼ ńgíŋe, ńgÿo ntse kwɔ́ʼɔ tà ḿbyága mmó gie á gẅiin zẅìge wɔ́, entse téen ńdáʼa ńgíŋe ńkwɔ́ʼɔ tà ńjÿó jʉʼ tà ńcʉŋte ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ wɔ́.»
en: I establish my covenant with you that never again will every creature be wiped out by floodwaters; there will never again be a flood to destroy the earth.”

ngiemboon: E Ssé gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Aliŋé gie n gee ńtÿɔ́gɔ, ńtí kʉ̀a gie pege gwǎa, tà mbɔɔ na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á gẅiin zẅìge tà ńtswéʼe na pi, tà mbɔɔ gie á ge láʼa gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, ayɔɔn:
en: And God said, “This is the sign of the covenant   I am making between me and you and every living creature with you, a covenant for all future generations:

ngiemboon: n kyɛ̌ lekwoŋ nnúngém sɔ́ɔn tsɛ́ɛ melɔ́ɔn, lekwoŋ nnúngém ŋwɛ́ é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ liŋé kʉ̀a gie á líe wɔ́ɔn tà mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ tà ńgẅiin zẅìge.
en: I have placed my bow in the clouds,   and it will be a sign of the covenant between me and the earth.

ngiemboon: Lekwoŋ nnúngém ŋwɛ́ ge láʼa kẅɛɛ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm gie n cuʼté melɔ́ɔn tà é jÿó jʉʼ.
en: Whenever I form clouds over the earth and the bow appears in the clouds,

ngiemboon: É kẅɛ púʼu, n dɔg ńkímte kʉ̀a gie n da gÿo pege gwa, á líe mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á gẅiin zẅìge, ń de gíŋe ńgÿo ntse kwɔ́ʼ ńjÿó ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ tà ḿbyága kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á gẅiin zẅìge wɔ́.
en: I will remember my covenant   between me and you and all the living creatures: water will never again become a flood to destroy every creature.

ngiemboon: N ge láʼa tsẅé líe lekwoŋ nnúngém, é lɔgɔ kímte kʉ̀a temì gie n da gÿo peg lâ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á gẅiin zẅìge ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ gwa.»
en: The bow will be in the clouds, and I will look at it and remember the permanent covenant   between God and all the living creatures on earth.”

ngiemboon: E Ssé gíŋe ńcwoŋo ńgɔɔn né Nowa ngie: «Lekwoŋ nnúngém, áa liŋé kʉ̀a gie n gÿǒ peg lâ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á gẅiin zẅìge ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ gwa.»
en: God said to Noah, “This is the sign of the covenant that I have established between me and every creature on earth.”

ngiemboon: Sɛm, Shÿâm ńgÿo Yafɛd, ée gubé Nowa gie pâ pɔ̌ la fó tsɛ̀ɛ páŋ ńkẅɛ. Kánàhan laa míŋ Shâm.
en: Noah’s sons who came out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Ham was the father of Canaan.

ngiemboon: Ngẅɛ̀ pʉ̀a mesoŋ la fó pɔ́ na penkʉ́ Nowa méntá, tá ḿbú ńjÿó ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ.
en: These three were Noah’s sons, and from them the whole earth was populated.

ngiemboon: Nowa cʉ́ʼʉ njʉ̀ʼngwóŋ, ḿbye metÿǒ melùʼ.
en: Noah, as a man of the soil, began by planting   a vineyard.

ngiemboon: À la nú melùʼ, ḿbím tà ńcʉ́ʼ ńnuŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ntàb ye pɔ́ te jÿɔ̌g nzsǒ.
en: He drank some of the wine, became drunk, and uncovered himself inside his tent.

ngiemboon: Shÿâm, tá pa Kánàhan gyá páʼ tá we Nowa nuŋe té jÿɔ́g nzsǒ, ńgʉa shwóŋ mefɛ̌ pé mépʉ́a pie é laa pǐ.
en: Ham, the father of Canaan, saw his father naked and told his two brothers outside.

ngiemboon: Sem pɔ́ Yafɛd leen ńjúʼ púʼu, ḿbíi pwó nzsǒ ńzába lekẅí, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ntàb pɔ́ nzèmenzème, tà ńgwaa záb nzsǒ na tá wɔ́b, pɔ́ té líe páʼ aa te nzsǒ jÿɔ́g wɔ́.
en: Then Shem and Japheth took a cloak and placed it over both their shoulders, and walking backward, they covered their father’s nakedness. Their faces were turned away, and they did not see their father naked.

ngiemboon: Melùʼ la gwɔ́ tà ḿmaga na Nowa, á júʼu nò gie Shÿâm gẅie aa ntsẅɛ́ ndá wé gÿo na yé.
en: When Noah awoke from his drinking and learned what his youngest son had done to him,

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: he said:

ngiemboon: Ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: He also said:

ngiemboon: E Ssé gÿo Yafɛd kẅiʼi ńgáʼ
en: Let God extend Japheth;

ngiemboon: Mentse mie é la kwɔ́ʼ ḿbú ńjÿó ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ la gwɔ́ tà ḿmag, Nowa gíŋe ńtsẅé ngùʼ móm tʉ̂a nzèm nkÿo tá.
en: Now Noah lived 350 years after the flood.

ngiemboon: À la gwaa kwé mbà à gẅǐin ngùʼ móm tʉ̂a nzèm nkÿo lepfwɔʼɔ́.
en: So Noah’s life lasted 950 years; then he died.
